changelog_entries.title: Update Tournament Committee article moving Azer to Alumni
Match object docs with TypeScript interface
Add user table column to lock changing email
Fix button area changing height when disabled
Fix sending multi-line message plain text chat error
Workaround beatmap discussions reply box having wrong background colour
Add changes to official tournament support from July 2023 TC meeting
Update `Official Tournament Support` deadline for submission of Badge Requests
Update "last updated" date for `Official tournament support`
Speed up assets building on non-native platform
Move WIP/pending beatmaps to graveyard when approving their beatmapset
Add API route for kudosu ranking
Add beatmapset search param for beatmapset events
Revert recent SSBO optimisations
changelog_entries.message: After pushing the SSBO masking changes to users, it turned out that the change was not an unambiguous performance win as originally hoped, and as such has been reverted for now in order to avoid diverting focus further away from more important concerns.
changelog_entries.message_html: After pushing the SSBO masking changes to users, it turned out that the change was not an unambiguous performance win as originally hoped, and as such has been reverted for now in order to avoid diverting focus further away from more important concerns.

changelog_entries.title: Make entire quick search user card a link
Add beatmapset difficulty name search filter
Add `osu!(lazer) Updates & The Path to Ranked Play` news post
Add `Monthly Beatmapping Contest: September 2023` news article
Add `New Featured Artist: Kommisar` news article
Add "difficulty" to website search filters in `Beatmap search`
Revert "Block input to objects lying under already-hit hitcircles when classic note lock is active"
Fix beatmap discussion jump to anchor position
Add default scope for solo score
Add support for shader storage buffer objects (SSBOs)
changelog_entries.message: SSBOs are a way to submit large amounts of data to GPUs. We now use this when possible as an optimisation everywhere in the game.
changelog_entries.message_html: SSBOs are a way to submit large amounts of data to GPUs. We now use this when possible as an optimisation everywhere in the game.

changelog_entries.title: Fix occasional crash when opening the editor
Fix multiplayer spectator potentially taking too long to start
changelog_entries.message:
When watching from the middle of gameplay, due to a series of failures, `SpectatorClock` would not get seeked to the current time, causing all clients to look like they were out of sync.

This is a hotfix for the issue. A better fix will require framework changes or considerable restructuring.
changelog_entries.message_html:
When watching from the middle of gameplay, due to a series of failures, SpectatorClock would not get seeked to the current time, causing all clients to look like they were out of sync.

This is a hotfix for the issue. A better fix will require framework changes or considerable restructuring.

changelog_entries.title: Allow running a main game instance while using the tournament client
changelog_entries.message: Was brought up (and hacked around) during COE. This allows starting the tournament client when osu! is already running, which can be useful for some scenarios. At COE it was used to allow streaming gameplay from the multiplayer spectator interface while still using the tournament client for bracket display (with manual updating on the side).
changelog_entries.message_html: Was brought up (and hacked around) during COE. This allows starting the tournament client when osu! is already running, which can be useful for some scenarios. At COE it was used to allow streaming gameplay from the multiplayer spectator interface while still using the tournament client for bracket display (with manual updating on the side).

changelog_entries.title: Allow gravity in RigidBodySimulation to be adjustable
Fix last slider control point type being included in legacy export
Allow "Last year's placing" in the tournament seeding to show "N/A" for new teams
changelog_entries.message:
Currently, there is no proper way to represent a team that did not place in the last year's tournament (e. g. new teams) in the seeding screen. The way I've seen this be handled is either setting it to some (arbitrary?) high value (e.g. https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1770154093?t=00h06m37s, new teams are shown as `#64`) or sometimes by just leaving it as `#1` (non-official and/or one-off tournaments).

This change increases the range to include zero (`1-256` -> `0-256`) , which also makes zero the default value for newly created teams (in the team editor).
changelog_entries.message_html:
Currently, there is no proper way to represent a team that did not place in the last year's tournament (e. g. new teams) in the seeding screen. The way I've seen this be handled is either setting it to some (arbitrary?) high value (e.g. https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1770154093?t=00h06m37s, new teams are shown as #64) or sometimes by just leaving it as #1 (non-official and/or one-off tournaments).

This change increases the range to include zero (1-256 -> 0-256) , which also makes zero the default value for newly created teams (in the team editor).

changelog_entries.title: Fix crash in tournament client when pick/ban is activated
Always show supporter-only playlist durations in dropdown
changelog_entries.message:
This allows better discoverability of durations which were previously hidden to non-supporters. I'd still like to improve this in the future but it's better than what we had.

![osu!_7fvQPtqQuX](https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/35318437/f78e4093-ad41-42c4-874f-930306b18d5c)
changelog_entries.message_html: This allows better discoverability of durations which were previously hidden to non-supporters. I'd still like to improve this in the future but it's better than what we had.

changelog_entries.title: Use SSBOs for bindless masking
changelog_entries.message: A huge forward step in general framework performance. Now we don't need to split draw calls when masking is toggled (generally a saving of 10-30% draw calls). This will lead to larger gains in the near future when we make texture atlases as large as they should be, pending some further work.
changelog_entries.message_html: A huge forward step in general framework performance. Now we don't need to split draw calls when masking is toggled (generally a saving of 10-30% draw calls). This will lead to larger gains in the near future when we make texture atlases as large as they should be, pending some further work.

changelog_entries.title: Fix hit animation not synchronizing when editing hit objects
Add D3D11VA video acceleration support
changelog_entries.message: The newer APIs should generally be used if possible, so D3D11VA > DXVA2 (which uses DX9). But vendor-specific implementations should still be preferred.
changelog_entries.message_html: The newer APIs should generally be used if possible, so D3D11VA > DXVA2 (which uses DX9). But vendor-specific implementations should still be preferred.

changelog_entries.title: Add test coverage for all video codecs
Add a cache busting mechanism to the shader compilation cache
Remove now unnecessary blur shader workaround
Add missing colon in mod settings tooltip
Show mod settings as "on" or "off" rather than "True" or "False"
Enable sentry "global mode" as per recommendation
Remove libavfilter where possible
changelog_entries.message: Reduces game filesize by 10-20mb depending on patform.
changelog_entries.message_html: Reduces game filesize by 10-20mb depending on patform.

changelog_entries.title: Rewrite `TestSceneObjectOrderedHitPolicy` to not rely on custom hitwindows
Add capability to export ordered object policy test cases for stable crosscheck
Change behaviour of `Storage.Move` to overwrite existing by default
Fix crash on minimising from non-native fullscreen resolutions
Update overlay pop-in/pop-out sample usage
changelog_entries.message:
An update to the pop-in/pop-out samples for various overlays. Also adds them to some overlays/popups that were previously missing them.

Updated/added samples for overlays:
- `ManageCollectionsDialog`, `ChatOverlay`, `FileChooserPopover`: new shared `overlay-big-x`
- `NotificationOverlay`, `OsuPopover` and children (report, mod presets, etc): updated shared `overlay-x`
- `SettingsPanel`: updated `settings-pop-in`
- `BeatmapOptionsOverlay` (aware there is a new design for this incoming, but I had created the samples prior to finding out, so PR'ing for use in the meantime anyway)
- `WaveOverlayContainer.cs`: updated `wave-pop-in` sample

Adds left/right panning to the pop-in/pop-out of:
- `LoginOverlay`
- `NotificationOverlay`
- `SettingsPanel`

Also tweaked on-click sample playback behaviour of some components that didn't work well with the overlay pop-in samples.
changelog_entries.message_html:
An update to the pop-in/pop-out samples for various overlays. Also adds them to some overlays/popups that were previously missing them.

Updated/added samples for overlays:

  • ManageCollectionsDialog, ChatOverlay, FileChooserPopover: new shared overlay-big-x
  • NotificationOverlay, OsuPopover and children (report, mod presets, etc): updated shared overlay-x
  • SettingsPanel: updated settings-pop-in
  • BeatmapOptionsOverlay (aware there is a new design for this incoming, but I had created the samples prior to finding out, so PR'ing for use in the meantime anyway)
  • WaveOverlayContainer.cs: updated wave-pop-in sample

Adds left/right panning to the pop-in/pop-out of:

  • LoginOverlay
  • NotificationOverlay
  • SettingsPanel

Also tweaked on-click sample playback behaviour of some components that didn't work well with the overlay pop-in samples.

changelog_entries.title: Fix potential race condition in song bar beatmap lookup flow
Fix hit circles fading out too fast when hit with classic mod active
changelog_entries.message: The animation adjustment applied in classic mod should be specific to when a player misses the hit circle, but it was applied regardless of the circle's state.
changelog_entries.message_html: The animation adjustment applied in classic mod should be specific to when a player misses the hit circle, but it was applied regardless of the circle's state.

changelog_entries.title: Correctly implement osu!stable "note-lock" in Classic mod
changelog_entries.message:
As far as I can tell, osu!stable note-lock was never implemented correctly in lazer. This implements osu!stable note-lock 1:1.

There are two obvious behavioral changes in this diff, though there may be more that are obscured by the details.

- Previously, clicks on stacked hitobjects which are note-locked cause shakes, while on osu!stable they don't (yes, despite the note being note-locked. stacks are special-cased on osu!stable.)
- osu!stable has a weird extra 3 ms of leniency before hitobjects can be note-locked. Not sure why — the "unsnapped objects" comment doesn't make much sense to me — but it's back now.
changelog_entries.message_html:
As far as I can tell, osu!stable note-lock was never implemented correctly in lazer. This implements osu!stable note-lock 1:1.

There are two obvious behavioral changes in this diff, though there may be more that are obscured by the details.

  • Previously, clicks on stacked hitobjects which are note-locked cause shakes, while on osu!stable they don't (yes, despite the note being note-locked. stacks are special-cased on osu!stable.)
  • osu!stable has a weird extra 3 ms of leniency before hitobjects can be note-locked. Not sure why — the "unsnapped objects" comment doesn't make much sense to me — but it's back now.

changelog_entries.title: Fix occasional crash when transitioning to results screen due to unsafe data access
Increased friends limit by 100%
changelog_entries.message:
This means you can now have 500 friends, or 1,000 if you are a supporter.

I made some changes to how friends were handled a while back to allow this in the future. It seems that we are finally at that future. No guarantees this won't break things, let's see!

changelog_entries.title: Bring an end to summer mode
changelog_entries.message: If you want to enjoy the summer fan art for longer, you can change the "Seasonal Backgrounds" setting to "Always" to bring them back. You can also find the fan art for download [here](https://osu.ppy.sh/home/news/2023-07-27-summer-splash) if you'd like to use one as a wallpaper!
